intro: Maba myriophylla, commonly known as the flame-of-forest, is a striking flowering plant native to the tropical regions of India and Sri Lanka. It is characterized by its vibrant orange-red bracts that resemble flames, which give the plant its common name. The plant belongs to the family Lythraceae and is known for its showy inflorescence that appears during the monsoon season.
